intro: Hedeoma ovata, commonly known as American hogweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its large, umbrella-like clusters of small white flowers and smooth, often hairy stems. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed and can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It thrives in moist environments such as wetlands and stream banks. Hedeoma ovata is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes other plants like carrots and parsley.
